section.title: Nimble Storage volume driver
section.para: Nimble Storage fully integrates with the OpenStack platform through the Nimble Cinder driver, allowing a host to configure and manage Nimble Storage array features through Block Storage interfaces.
Support for the Liberty release is available from Nimble OS 2.3.8 or later.

listitem.para: Create, delete, clone, attach, and detach volumes
Create a volume from a snapshot
Copy an image to a volume
Copy a volume to an image
Enable encryption and default performance policy for a volume-type using extra-specs

note.para: The Nimble Storage implementation uses iSCSI only. Fibre Channel is not supported.

section.title: Nimble Storage driver configuration
section.para: Update the file /etc/cinder/cinder.conf with the given configuration.
In case of a basic (single back-end) configuration, add the parameters within the [default] section as follows.
section.programlisting: [default] san_ip = NIMBLE_MGMT_IP san_login = NIMBLE_USER san_password = NIMBLE_PASSWORD volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.nimble.NimbleISCSIDriver
section.para: In case of multi back-end configuration, for example, configuration which supports multiple Nimble Storage arrays or a single Nimble Storage array with arrays from other vendors, use the following parameters.
section.programlisting:
[default] enabled_backends = Nimble-Cinder
[Nimble-Cinder] san_ip = NIMBLE_MGMT_IP san_login = NIMBLE_USER san_password = NIMBLE_PASSWORD volume_driver = cinder.volume.drivers.nimble.NimbleISCSIDriver volume_backend_name = NIMBLE_BACKEND_NAME
section.para: In case of multi back-end configuration, Nimble Storage volume-type is created and associated with a back-end name as follows.

note.para: Single back-end configuration users do not need to create the volume-type.

section.para: This section explains the variables used above:

listitem.para: Management IP address of Nimble Storage array/group.
Nimble Storage account login with minimum "power user"(admin) privilege if RBAC is used.
Password of the admin account for nimble array.
A volume back-end name which is specified in cinder.conf. This is also used while assigning a back- end name to the Nimble volume-type.
The Nimble volume-type which is created from CLI and associated with NIMBLE_BACKEND_NAME.

section.para: After updating the cinder.conf, the cinder-api, cinder-scheduler, and cinder-volume needs to be restarted.

section.title: Nimble driver extra specs
section.para: Nimble volume driver also supports the following extra specs options:

listitem.para: Used to enable encryption for a volume-type
PERF_POL_NAME is the name of a performance policy which exists on the Nimble array and should be enabled for every volume in a volume-type

section.para: These extra-specs can be enabled by using the following command:

screen.userinput: cinder type-key \ VOLUME_TYPE set KEY=\ VALUE

section.para: VOLUME_TYPE is the Nimble volume-type and KEY and VALUE are the options mentioned above.
